reviews.title: Dirty
reviews.text: Went with my girlfriend and her family as I was visiting Balikpapan, sat down under umbrellas and on the mats. Good food and coconuts but the water was extremely dirty, very brown and the sewerage runs straight into the sea so was not comfortable swimming in it. Maybe better on another day

reviews.title: Terrible dirty beach
reviews.text: Beach covered with dead coral the water is dirty and trash all over the beach. Has improved somewhat in the last 2 years but still not a good place to swim!

reviews.title: banyak perubahan
reviews.text: setelah direnovasi jadi kelihatan lebih luas, banyak pondokan juga dibangun dipinggir2, yang jualan juga banyak, cocok sih untuk piknik keluargaüëç

reviews.title: Salah satu pantai terkenal di balikpapan
reviews.text:
Harga tiket masuk Rp.20.000/orang
Mobil Rp.5.000

Bersantai boleh lah disini.

Melepas penat kesibukan dengan bermain di pantai.

Saran je pengelola:

reviews.title: menarik
reviews.text: pantainya cukup bersih dan enak untuk menunggu sunset cocok untuk rekreasi keluarga dan teman-teman dan kekasih

reviews.title: Pantai Favorit di Balikpapan
reviews.text:
Pantai yang berpasir hitam dengan ombak yang tidak besar.
menyenangkan untuk  bermain air dan pasir, tersedia toilet atau tempat berbilas  berbayar umum di lokasi.
Terdapat patung Beruang yang besar dan ayunan untuk berfoto ala ala gili trawangan, sayang nya ada tertulis Nama hotel di atas nya (mungkin sponsor), semoga sponsor tsb bs segera memperbaiki krn kondisi ayunan sudah mengkhawatirkan.

reviews.title: Pantai yang terus berbenah
reviews.text: Ketika saya berkunjung ke pantai ini, sedang terjadi renovasi besar-besaran, diharapkan dalam tiga bulan lagi, banyak fasilitas tambahan pada pantai ini. Pantainya cukup bagus dan luas.

reviews.title: Lumayan Buat Rekreasi
reviews.text: antai Manggar jia hari Libur sangat padat , air laut cenderung kotor, kalau buat santai dan duduk duduk lumayan bisa menghilangkan kepenatan, akan tetapi jika hendak membebli makan dan minum hendaknya bertanya dahulu sebelum kantong anda jebol, bagi kantong tebal langsung pesan saja tidak apa apa

reviews.title: Saat libur ramai sekali
reviews.text: Pantai ini tergolong cukup lengkap fasilitasnya, warung/rumah makan, toilet, kamar mandi, sewa ban berenang, sepertinya ada juga permainan seperti banan boat dsb. Retribusi untuk masuk ke pantai ini juga tergolong murah. Hanya berjarak 30 menit berkendara dari Balikapapan. Menurut informasi yang saya terima, jika libur panjang maka pengunjung tidak hanya dari Balikapapan, ada juga dari Samarinda dan Tenggarong.

reviews.title: Cocok untuk berenang
reviews.text: Pantai manggar cocok untuk wisata keluarga, siapa saja bisa berenang dan main air disini. Ada penyewaan pelampung dll, jika lapar juga banyak yang berjualan. Para penjual menggelar tikar diatas pasir utk pengunjung, cukup membeli sesuatu kita bisa duduk atau bahkan tidur2an ditikar yang disediakan, saya membeli kelapa muda dengan harga 15.000/buah. Kamar mandi juga tersedia dengan membayar 3.000-5.000 (saya lupa) tapi sayangnya tdk bersih. Untuk masuk pantai ini dikenakan biaya masuk 3.000 untuk dewasa, 2.000 untuk anak dan 10.000 untuk mobil.

reviews.title: pantai langganan wisatawan kaltim pas hari libur
reviews.text: jaraknya agak jauh dari pusat kota, gampang dijangkau dengan mobil atau motor juga angkot, pantainya kurang terawat, harga makanan relatif mahal, kalau hari libur nasional bisa penuh

reviews.title: Manggar
reviews.text: Nama yang banyak juga di tempat lain, berhubungan dengan nama buah mungkin. Pantai ini bagus buat penyegaran an jasmani dengan hawa lautnya yang sejuk

reviews.title: Rekreasi Murah namun asik juga
reviews.text: Tempat ini sudah sering saya dan keluarga datangi untuk menghabiskan waktu libur. Cukup menyenangkan, hanya memang air lautnya tidak sebersih pantai2 di tempat lainnya. Namun cukup oke lah untuk liburan murah nan meriah... :D

reviews.title: Bersantai di Manggar
reviews.text: Pantai Manggar merupakan salah satu pantai favorit yang ada di Kota Balikpapan. Setiap akhir pekan atau hari libur banyak wisatawan yang mengunjungi pantai ini. Untuk menuju pantai ini bisa ditempuh menggunakan kendaraan pribadi ataupun bisa naik angkot nomor 7 dari terminal BP. Pantai ini cocok sekali untuk liburan keluarga karena areanya yang luas serta juga memiliki bibir pantai yang luas. Disini kita bisa sekedar mandi laut ataupun bercengkerama dengan sanak keluarga sambil menikmati angin pantai.

reviews.title: Pantai.....
reviews.text:
Siapa sih yang ga suka liat pantai,

Pasirnya putih, ombaknya juga ga besar besar amat, sekarang sudah di lengkapi Permainan Banana Boat, padahal sekitar setahun yang lalu permainan tersebut belum ada.

Seperti tempat tempat lain di kota ini, semuanya sangat bersih, jarang sekali terlihat sampah berserakan bahkan nyaris tidak ada.

Salut sama kota balikpapan,

Saya dan keluarga sangat suka pantai ini !

reviews.title: Pantai Wisata Keluarga
reviews.text:
Pantai Manggar merupakan pantai favorit destinasi liburan keluarga. Pantai ini telah dilengkapi oleh fasilitas umum yang memadai seperti kamar bilas, warung makan dan restoran, toilet, warung, lahan parkir, serta fasilitas hiburan air seperti boat dan beberapa permainan air. Pantai ini sangat indah, dengan pasir putih dan ombak yang tenang. Jika Anda hobi renang, maka jangan lupa untuk membawa pakaian renang terbaik Anda, karena struktur pantai yang landai dan jumlah karang yang sedikit menjadikan pantai ini cukup sempurna untuk melakukan aktivitas di air. Pemandangan langit di sore hari sangat mengesankan, dengan biasan cahaya matahari yang mulai tenggelam menghasilkan siluet langit berwarna jingga dan ungu, sangat sempurna bagi landscape photography.
Untuk menikmati pantai ini, sedikit biaya masuk akan dikenakan kepada para wisatawan, yaitu (jika tidak salah) IDR 3.000 untuk anak-anak dan IDR 5.000 untuk dewasa.
Pantai ini dapat diakses dengan menempuh perjalanan sekitar 30 menit dari kota Balikpapan ke arah timur laut menggunakan kendaraan pribadi. Saya tidak yakin apakah ada transportasi publik yang menuju rute ini, sehingga menyewa kendaraan roda dua merupakan pilihan yang cukup logis untuk saya.

reviews.title: sedikit lebih baik
reviews.text:
Kondisi nya sedikit lebih baik dari terakhir kali sekitar tahun 2009 saat saya kesana, sudah mulai dilengkapi dengan sarana penunjang sebagaimana layaknya suatu tempat wisata, sayang nya untuk kebersihan masih belum. 
genangan air dibeberapa tempat masih terlihat dan banyak nyamuk, baru sebagian kecil area pantai yang mendapatkan pengelolaan dengan baik, selebih nya masih tidak.

reviews.title: Pantai dengan ombak tenang
reviews.text: Seperti pantai biasa pada umumnya sih, di pantai ini menyediakan makanan dan minuman ada juga jual souvenir khas pantai manggar

reviews.title: beautiful beach
reviews.text: Pantai yang sangat indah, karena ombak tidak terlalu besar. Recomended untuk family holiday. terawdia bananaboat serta tempat makan yang sangat nyaman

reviews.title: Good Beach
reviews.text: Pantai ini cukup indah dan lumayan jika mau berwisata kesini. Meski ombak tidak besar cukup aman jika sekedar ingin bermain2 dengan ombak. Sewaktu saya kesani kondisi sampah masih berserakan.

name: Transmart Carrefour

photo.caption: Various joy rides and play station games for children

reviews.title: "Not the best but not the worst"
reviews.text:
Transmart, a one way ticket to enjoyment for 30 minutes and a shopping center. It was a huge place for a supermarket with an amusement park, it was 5 minutes ride from my house since it's very near with the location. Transmart located at Mt Haryono road in South of Balikpapan.

It was a nice shiny day, so my ride to the location was okay.

As we arrive at the location, the surrounding areas aren't really that crowded. Most of the visitor who at the location are mostly just for shopping. At the first brief look I weren't expecting much about the shopping are since my real target was the amusement park at the 3rd Floor. After we manage to arrive at the place. most of the rides that available aren't really my type. 75% of the ride were targeted for children like  City convoy, Bumpy cars, Happy swing, Sky rider, Soft Play. And the only adult ride that I found a bit enjoyable is the roller coaster. After 30 minutes of walking around searching for the perfect ride for me, slowly but surely I'm starting to bored, most of my sister and brother still have the energy to enjoy the fun. In the end it's just a waste of time for me.

To cover my boredom, me and my mother goes to the 2nd floor for shopping. I weren't expecting that much space for a huge row of aisles. For a supermarket in Balikpapan it was fully available in needs of household. I was overwhelmed on how much things that I need to fulfill. After shopping for a whopping 4 hours, followed with everyone finished doing the rides, We go to the cashier to pay and finally able to go home and take a rest.

In the end, I'm a bit mixed about the place. As in for the amusement park, I found it quite unenjoyable and boring, but I get it that this studio is small and it's called mini  trans studio so make sense. Yet if you want to at least have fun and waste your time with you're family, I highly suggest for you to visit this place and also the price for the entrance is very cheap and affordable for everyone. And for the supermarket I very suggested you to try to go shopping here as I found it very fully stocked in daily needs and most of the price are economical.

reviews.title: Amusement Park
reviews.text: went there with my family around 10am, it was not too packed, but hours later it turned to be so busy. this area offers quite options for kids to play. the rides not too many options for adult. this area also has cinema, supermarket, restaurants and department store. so if you plan to spend some time with family, it is a one stop place. toilet not too clean and always long queuing.

reviews.title: Transmart Standard to Fast Complete Our Daily Need
reviews.text:
Not far from our house. Place where I can buy natural chicken and less fat meat for my family. My husband prefer for this kind of chicken and meat so we like to go there. Some daily care, like refill for  fabric freshener, only we can meet there. For these reasons, we go there.

But our kids know that they can play at the playground. We use that moment. When they tired after playing, go around the supermarket to accompany me buy some daily needs (they got something they need too), will make them hungry. Buy some foods also our choice. 

So its like 1 stop shop for us where we can buy daily needs, children can have some enjoy moment to play and also the food itself. So I don't have to think about our family menu, hahaha. We like the bakery shop too. Our favorites are mini danish cookies. But by any chance, we bored with this place.

Nothing new. Children felt that way either. No new challenge at the playground. So sometime, if we got bored, we will find another place. Even if it makes me not to have all the daily need in one place. üòâüòâ

reviews.title: grocery and amusement park
reviews.text: If you want to do grocery and bring your kids to amusement park, then this is the good place to go. The trans-studio mini is worth trying.

reviews.title: Oasis in Oil city
reviews.text:
Quite difficult to look place which can accommodate all segment include with family in Balikpapan..all place who have now mostly like mall and other already make bored..Trans mart give an alternative which family can have an alternative to elaborate and explore, easy access like,  clean area, cool enough and more kid play ground to have game
Recommended for all family

reviews.title: Great for kids! Nice bakery
reviews.text:
Transmart is a decent place to spend your afternoon at.

It follows a concept of a big multi-storey shops with one gated check out system at the entrance. Basically once you went it, you could go to the second and third floor still carrying the items that you grab from the first floor. Once you're finished then you just go down to the first floor to check out. 

At the top there's a mini theme park, meant for kids really because the attraction's seating arrangement and sizes are quite small. There's a rollercoaster inside for those who want to take their kids for a non-extreme fun indoor. 

Overall, the place is quite clean, and quite spacious to walk around in. The bakery at the first floor is amazing! Try to come early when they just finished baking it. Its cheap and quite decent really.

One minus for me is the parking lot and the pavement leading up to the entrance. Parking lot could be bigger and the pavement have a lot of holes. 

Other than that it's quite recommended at least for a single visit.

reviews.title: mini version of Trans Studio
reviews.text:
A place that must go for someone who want to enjoy rides like the one in Dufan or Trans Studio but like the slogan says its just the mini version of it. Adult and kids can enjoy playing here.
The brand for daily needs is limited, maybe because the place is small so they can not put much things.

For me its so difficult to go there since theres no public transportation that going there

reviews.title: Cool....
reviews.text: Free parking during the promo. but quite far away from the main door. comfortable and interesting place. Jetcoaster rides and a variety of other games that resemble in Trans Studio. very interesting.

reviews.title: new place for one stop shopping
reviews.text: good place for your family to hang out but if you want to buy cloth, cosmetic, etc they just have limited product and brand.

reviews.title: Joy rides for children
reviews.text:
This is a small mall for the needs of the locals. However all things required are available.
If you are accompanying children then it is a must visit to this place. The joy rides are indoor and is suitable for even rainy days and I have not seen in any other mall in Balikpapan.

reviews.title: Transmart yang Cukup Lengkap
reviews.text: Tempat berbelanja bulanan sesekali, Cukup lengkap. Rasanya aneh kalo kesini gak belanja apa-apa, hehe..

reviews.title: one stop shopping
reviews.text: tempat ini dilengkapi dengan mainan dan resto yang masih satu manajemen dengan transmart seperti wendys, baskin robbin, namun ada juga tenant lainnya. Untuk pusat belanja, suasana tidak terlalu ramai. Entah karena lokasi atau makin banyak saingan di bisnis retail. Harga sama seperti supermarket besar lainnya.

reviews.title: liburan....
reviews.text: permainan cukup banyak pilihan, buat ibu- ibu bisa shoping juga dibawah, ada food court juga keren banget......

reviews.title: My review
reviews.text: Salah satu pusat perbelanjaan terbaik di Kota Balikpapan, banyak promo, dan terdapat beberapa pilihan food court. Untuk parkir gratis namun ada syarat minimum belanja. Selain itu tak lupa, disini terdapat wahana Trans Studio Mini pertama di Kalimantan.

reviews.title: Total solusi belanja, makan dan bermain
reviews.text: Bila pada akhir pekan atau hari libur ingin mengajak anak-anak bermain, sementara orang tua berbelanja, ada tempat yang memberikan layanan lengkap, yakni TransMart Balikpapan. Terdapat sekitar 8 permainan utama dan banyak mesin permainan untuk memuaskan anak-anak. Orang tua dapat berbelanja kebutuhan sehari-hari dari makanan, pakaian, obat, kebutuhan pribadi, hingga elektronik. Bila lapar seluruh keluarga dapat menikmati makan siang / malam pada gerai makanan yang tersedia. Lahan parkir juga cukup luas.

reviews.title: Jalan jalan
reviews.text: Bagus banget transmart tapi terlalu mahal juga.tapi gak papa lah yang penting pasangan aku seneng karna tempat favorit nya itu transmart.makasih transmart

reviews.title: Kebutuhan sehari-hari dan indoor micro amusement park
reviews.text: Tempat ini memiliki konsep one stop shopping sekaligus ada taman bermain kecil indoor d lantai atasnya. Bagi yang ingin berbelanja juga ingin sekalian membawa anak-anak bermain, maka bawalah ke Transmart ini. Apabila lapar melanda, bisa langsung makan di salah satu restoran yang ada di lantai dasar. Pergilah saat weekend karena banyak promo makanan, datanglah awal karena weekend biasanya lumayan ramai. Selalu awasi anak-anak Anda saat bermain agar selalu dalam kondisi yang aman.

reviews.title: Tempat belanja lengkap
reviews.text: Ke transmart untuk belanja saja. Tempat ini menyediakan sarana yag lengkap. Selain untuk belanja kebutuhan sehari-hari, tempat ini juga menyediakan berbagai kebutuhan sandang, peralatan elektronik, tempat makan dan wahana bermain. Terletak tidak jauh dari rumah. Hanya saja ketika hujan deras, akses menuju ke sana sering sekali banjir.

reviews.title: Tempat main sekaligus tempat perbelanjaan
reviews.text: Tempat bermainnya bagus banyak macamnya. Anaknya main mamanya bisa belanja. Untuk  belanja pengguna debit mega dpt potongan 5% kalau kartu kredit mega dpt 10% di permainan jg sering diskon üòÑüëç

reviews.title: Bermain Di Transmini
reviews.text: Transmart Carrefour merupakan pusat perbelanjaan terbaru yang hadir di Balikpapan. Lokasinya ada di Jl. MT Haryono, Balikpapan. Tidak ada transportasi umum yang tepat melewati depan mall tersebut. Kalau kita mau naik angkot jadi dari terminal Batu Ampar bisa naik angkot warna hijau 2A turun di perempatan Balikpapan Baru selanjutnya jalan kaki +- 1km. Mall terbaru ini selain menjadi pusat perbelanjaan, mall inipun dilengkapi dengan wahana permainan seperti yang ada di transtudio Makassar/ Bandung tapi dalam versi mini.  Cocok untuk orang tua yang akan berbelanja serta membawa anaknya untuk sekedar menikmati wahana permainanya.

reviews.title: Bangkirai Hill Nature Tourism in the Rain Forest of Borneo
reviews.text: Located in the rain forest of Borneo. Close to Balikpapan, Kalimantan Timur, Indonesia. Representative of rain forest of Borneo that almost extinct. You can explore this places just 1 hour from Balikpapan.

reviews.title: Isabelle (France)
reviews.text:
Safe and wonderful canopy tour with an English speaking guide, allowing you to have a fantastic overview on the forest and also excellent for birds and monkeys observation. 
Interestingly, at that place, I also made a 2 hour trek during the night with a ranger and we saw different mammals (civets,...), owls and tarentule. Highly recommended
Also, close to that place, make a boat trip with a local fisherman on the black river, where you‚Äôll see probiotic monkeys with their huge nose +++

reviews.title: Amazing natural tourism
reviews.text: Bangkirai hill is great natural tourim, the air is fresh, natural forest, sound of animal is amazing. coolll. but before to this place you will feel bad roads around 15 km. I hope government or stakeholder immediately roads repair

reviews.title: Excellent place for adventure
reviews.text: It‚Äôs quite far from the city by car, just make sure that you get yourself an SUV to go there for safety reasons due to the weather; but when you get there it‚Äôs all worth it üëçüèª the super high tree topsüå≥ were amazing and the hanging bridges connecting the trees are not something you can experience every day

reviews.title: Great walk through the jungle with a very high tree top walkway.
reviews.text: Very interesting walk through the jungle with a lot of wildlife seen and heard and a very high (30m i believe) tree top walkway. There was lots more on offer with zip lines and all sorts but we only opted for the walk.

reviews.title: Hanging Bridges are nice
reviews.text: Good and nice for a short Jungle trek.. 40 km away or 1,5 hours drive from Balikpapan. There are some bridges among the trees. Jungle trekking and good weather.

reviews.title: Excellen place when you want to get closer with nature
reviews.text: This place is basically a rain forest with majority of Bangkirai trees. It has cottages for tourists to spent a night or two. You need to reserve it.This place is suitable also for family with young children or teens. Types of activities you can have here: BBQ, karaoke, outbond, nature sightseeing etc. Located on KM 28 of Soekarno Hatta street of Balikpapan

reviews.title: Simple yet satisfying nature adventure for family
reviews.text: Interesting place for children to explore and get close to nature with some thrilling actions. Good place to spend time together with family and friends. Not too far from Balikpapan.

reviews.title: Thrilling but nice trip
reviews.text: to get to this location takes about 1 hour from Balikpapan. dont use your gmaps unless you will get lost in the palm-oil plantation ( I really did this !). The forest is natural and you can rise to high stairs bridge. there is lodging facility in area, you can spend 1-2 nights to feel the real forest of Kalimantan

reviews.title: Adventurer
reviews.text: Nice place for looking fresh air and jungle. It's far from the city but worthed to visit, if you scare of high don't try to go to the canopy but you still can enjoy other activity.

reviews.title: Lots of fun
reviews.text: It was a great time to spend here, especially if you are an adventurer and not scared of height üòÖ It is about 2 hours to get in and you must try all of the attractions they offer. Use your sneakers and dont use sandals. And bring your own drink and also buy your bridge ticket in the reception. They dont sell it in the rest place. Better come in the morning or after 2pm.

reviews.title: Bukit Bangkirai
reviews.text:
Worth the trip,  nice view over the jungle from the top of the canopy. 
You can borrow for a small fee Dayak clothes and take photos. 
Downside: access road, parking place,  garden,  etc, not maintained as it should be. This is unfortunately quite common in Indonesia

reviews.title: extreme spot
reviews.text: Bit far from Balikpapan city its around 1 hour to this place, but not recommended for kid or old people, this place good for people who love adventure and back to nature, limited facilities, please prepare with lotion to avoid mosquito or another insect

reviews.title: Kids day out...üòäüòä
reviews.text: This rainforest was just awesome....a great place to do jungle track and birds view and plants study....! At this are we can also walk through sky-bridge on more than 30 mtr high from the ground. Its really beautiful scenery from up-here.

reviews.title: Bangkirai suspension walk
reviews.text: The whole experience here is to be recommended. Helpful people and information in the office, well prepared access walk through dense forest, exciting though short walk across 3 spans suspended from huge Bangkirai tree trunks to a lookout across a forested valley. We are not very fit, but accomplished this easily. There are other forest paths we could have taken, and did see reasonable cottages to overnight in, but after a snack at the little cafe, we headed off to Samboja.

reviews.title: This is the real deal
reviews.text: If you are an adrenaline junkie, then this is a must! walking 30 meters above the ground is one hell of sensation.

reviews.title: Nice trails, adopt a tree program and fair pricing!
reviews.text: Went on a Sunday, not crowded , friendly visitors and I was allowed to pay the local rate as long as I showed them my KITAS or KITAP!! Make sure you kill the termites SOON!

reviews.title: Nature for young
reviews.text: After continuously dealing with shop, mall, and city life, its fun to escape to nature for once in a while. And visiting bukit bangkirai can be fun, eventhough my kids are still very young. As they grow older later its important that they also love nature and big trees, and this trip allow them to experience the first time

reviews.title: Experiencing skin of Kalimantan forestry
reviews.text: It was quite far from the city but it was an enjoyable experience to visit the forestry area of Kalimantan. You'd better come here.

reviews.title: Nice outdoor vacation
reviews.text: Its fun for family trip in this wood ...bangkirai tree hanging bridge you must try n another site for test adventure your family ...wear a tshirt bring for more water use a cap sun glassess is recomended

ranking: #8 of 39 things to do in Balikpapan

reviews.title: Juat the beach
reviews.text: If you love the beach ....you like to be here ...nothing else ...good spot but dont have anything for meal..sit...or toilet

reviews.title: The beach near Melawai
reviews.text: In Balikpapan, Melawai is popular to hangout. But near Melawai, there is a beach you can visit, called Benua Patra beach. It's alternative place to hang out with your friend to see sunset in Balikpapan. I recomended this place for friends, but not your family, because the terrain is quite difficult

reviews.title: Beach location close to mining company
reviews.text: This beach location is close to Mining Company (Pertamina) where you can see some mining workers around the area when they finish work. I didn't spend much time there but was good to know one of the objects. The location is reachable distance which is about 15-20mnts from the central town.

reviews.title: Sunset View
reviews.text: Benua patra beach is one of location that owned by PERTAMINA. It ussually provide for their family recreation and gathering. But now it seems open for public so we could visit it for free. A long the beach you could spend time with your family for swiming, creating sand statute or just waiting for sunset come up. So prepare your camera for the beautiful moment you will get there.

reviews.title: very interesting beach
reviews.text: Rocky beach with clear water, you can capture a wonderful sunset from this beach. Bring tripod and camera, to get beautiful slow speed capture.

reviews.title: You can see sunset but the beach is dirty.
reviews.text: If you are visitor, tourist, who visited Balikpapan in a short time, this place is not recommended. Could be good spot of to watch sunrise with your camera, but the beach is dirty.

reviews.title: Interesting But Risky

reviews.title: Pantai Banua Patra a nice place to visit
reviews.text:
The beach is situated across the popular Lapangan Merdeka (Merdeka Field). There is a huge Sport Center, and just behind the building you can find the Chopper field, and the beach.
The first time, I came to this place it was in the late afternoon and spent most of my time at the Chopper field on the left side of the beach. I took some pictures of the city scrapers and the couples and some group of people just hanging around waiting for the sunset.
My last visit, two weeks ago, I explored the rugged beach (the right side of the beach to the direction of Melawai Beach). There is a little rugged rock where people like take pre-wedding picture. When you climb up the rock and you can find another secluded little beach. If you walk further, you can take picture of the hill scattered by houses. This used-to-be ford location, is a good place to take picture of the sunset. Over weekend you will find many photographers here.

reviews.title: My experience
reviews.text:
I have lived in Balikpapan city since i was born and pentacity is the best mall to go to in Balikpapan
Even though this mall is not as large as malls in other cities such as: Surabaya and Bali, There are cinemas, restaurants, clothes stores, supermarkets, and other services available.
Pentacity has a variety of businesses and restaurants, including Starbucks, Excelso, and a variety of restaurants.
If you want to buy branded clothing, there are several branded clothing stores to visit, such as H&M, Sogo, and Some other stores. 
There are also hotels nearby, including in the mall's vicinity.
Because this is a new mall, there are a few empty areas, but there will be more stores coming to make it better.
As a result, it can be stated that this mall is a good site to visit for family amusement for those of you who may be visiting from outside the city of Balikpapan or who are Balikpapan natives.

reviews.title: My experience visiting Pentacity Balikpapan
reviews.text:
Hello friends, 

Today I‚Äôd like to talk about my experience visiting Pentacity Balikpapan. It was such a pleasurable experience and I‚Äôd really like to share that with you.

I felt very secure upon reaching as I had to go through a temperature check and security check to make sure that everything was alright and that I was fit to enter the mall. Then the hand sanitizing station to ensure that our hands are clean upon entering.

I then had lunch at The People‚Äôs Cafe which was an amazing experience. I ordered the fish & chips which I really like and iced tea. The food was delicious. I then went to have a drink at Kokumi which is a bubble tea store. I really enjoy their Okinawa Brown Sugar. You should request for less sugar because it can be a little too sweet.

I then walked around the mall as there are ample stores to explore, clothing stores, shoe stores, and many more. My favorite store has to be Miniso as they sell a plethora of home goods.

As covid is still rampant in town, I had to cut my window shopping short, so that was all I did for my day at Pentacity mall.

I really enjoyed my day there, and I wish that when the pandemic is over, I get to walk around it more freely than I can now.

reviews.title: Probably the best mall to visit in Balikpapan
reviews.text: Even though Balikpapan is a small city, the mall here is an exception, especially Pentacity. Pentacity is a mall that had been built since 2018 and it is built beside another mall which is called E-walk, which has been there since the early 2010s. Although this mall is not as big as malls in other cities, this mall has provided more than enough entertainment for the residents of Balikpapan, ranging from cinemas, restaurants, clothing stores, supermarkets, etc., all available there. If you want to buy branded clothes, there are several branded clothes shops that you can visit for example H&M, Sogo, Hush puppies or for example you want to eat there, there are many choices of restaurants, ranging from Japanese, Korean, Chinese, and Indonesian food. So it can be concluded that this mall is a suitable place to visit for family entertainment for those of you who may come from outside the city of Balikpapan and are natives of the city of Balikpapan.

reviews.title: Pentacity
reviews.text: I want to share my experience visiting Pentacity Balikpapan, Pentacity Balikpapan is one of the biggest and famous malls in Balikpapan and it‚Äôs not just one but it‚Äôs connected with another mall called Ewalk so if you want to explore you can explore both of them Pentacity is a huge mall. There are different shops and places in Pentacity, they have Starbucks, Kokumi, and many different kinds of restaurants but both of the examples are my favorite drinks in Pentacity. Not only does Restaurant Pentacity have a swimming place named Aqua Boom it‚Äôs a fun place because there‚Äôs a lot of slides in Aqua Boom and it‚Äôs a great place to relax talking about relaxed Pentacity have movie theatre called XXI, but it's also a great place to watch movies with friends or family. When the pandemic ends I recommend you guys to go to this mall because it's good for everyone. You can have many activities in this mall and it has a lot of chill spots which you can bring your friends or family to.

reviews.title: E-walk
reviews.text: Pentacity is one of the biggest mall in Balikpapan, not just a big mall but this mall also a place where everyone would go when weekend. Pentacity is a very unique mall because it linked to another mall called E-walk, just like Tunjungan Plaza at Surabaya.  Pentacity is more modern than E-walk, but the type of shops still complement each other (There are Pizza Hut, Funstation, The Executive and many more on E-walk. While Pentacity have Hypermart, KFC, H&M etc). Not just that, but around Pentacity there is shop house and also hotels which tourist can sleep beside on the mall. I like Pentacity more because I like japanese food and there are many japanese restaurant on Pentacity, and also there is cinema and I really like watching movies especially Marvel Movies. However, I don't really like the escalator arrangement because the mall is like circular-shaped and we need to walk a semi-circle of it to go to the next level or lower level of the mall. But I still very recommend to go here when the virus Covid-19 is gone, you can do many things here like hangout with friends, watch cinema with family, shopping and many other things.

reviews.title: Millennials' Mall
reviews.text: Pentacity Mall is the newest, biggest and the best mall in Balikpapan from what I see. It is connected with BSB or Ewalk Balikpapan Superblock mall. Since this mall is a new mall, the design is modern and very pretty for me. The design is very calming, with white color vibe which is very high class. The toilet, comparing to BSB mall‚Äôs is much more clean and designed more modern. Nonetheless, there is a restaurant which makes me loss my appetite. The place is very dirty and smells very bad.. Even it is still new, there are many things we could find there such as restaurants, fashion stores (which is very millennial), supermarket, game center, snack sellers, even cinema and many more. Many popular brands such as SOGO, H&M, Charles & Keith and many more. There are also hotels near, even in the area of the mall. I personally like Pentacity out of all mall in this city. There are many empty spots in this mall since it is a new mall, but I believe this mall will develop even better. I absolutely recommend you to visit Pentacity if you are in Balikpapan. It is very suitable for any ages, especially for millennial kids like me.

reviews.title: fun and affordable.
reviews.text:
If you're a person looking for a fun day out in the sun without worrying about your budget, then this place is for you! I personally liked going to the beach but I won't be able to go out for a while due to the pandemic. No need to fret, I'm about to share my personal thoughts about it so readers like you can have a general idea about it :)

It was around 7 months ago since I've last gone out to have fun in the sun and as vaguely as I remember, it was quite bright and perfect for tanning. I'm not a fan of tanning my skin but it does feel great to dip your toes in its cooling saltwater. 

Temperatures aside, this beach is filled with many activities you can do with your family. For instance, I went out in mid-February for a relaxing day with the whole family and we had a picnic there near the forest opening. The little ones tend to dugout pits and try to capture as many snails and whelks from the shore. It was warm, and yet, it felt really breezy and refreshing since there's so many trees towering over us with shade.

There isn't much rubbish around the sandy areas, but sadly, the water was murky and trash seems to washed-up often to the seashore so we tend to avoid it in order to avoid any rashes or some sort. 

The people there are definitely friendly and there is a lot of space to do outdoor sports and things alike. I would definitely recommend people to visit this beach.

reviews.title: Lamaru beach
reviews.text: I spent several hours hanging on Lamaru Beach. The sand was very soft, the ocean water was too cold for me but still nice and refreshing, and there was plenty of space to relax among numerous friendly people on the beach. There are lots of stores, restaurants, and other attractions there as well. Parking is hit or miss, but we found something pretty quickly . This will probably be our go to spot every time we're in Balikpapan.

reviews.title: Nice Beach
reviews.text:
Very nice beach. The water is ok and the beach started from a nice forest.
The entry is a little bit to expensive.

reviews.title: White sand Beach
reviews.text: The good one of destination at Balikpapan, White sand beach and suitable for family gathering or family vacation.

reviews.title: A curious visit to see the beach
reviews.text: Had to pay entrance fee for 100k for 4 person. The attendant said its for free use of toilet . The beach was very empty. Nothing much to see. Just dry pine trees. So frustrating and disappointing.

reviews.title: Beach
reviews.text: Nice view good coconut clean ....best for relax ...n play with the children ....many attraction you can rent...golf car ...banana boat ...outbond and many more just bring your family to enjoy

reviews.title: Pine trees on the beach
reviews.text: Lamaru is surrounded by pine trees on its beach so it is quite windy on the hot day. This is the better place to hang around with friends than Manggar beach. A few hawkers sell canned drinks & light food. If you wanna spend a day there, I suggest bring some food for meals

reviews.title: Family outing
reviews.text: Best family bonding! The area is clean and good for picnic. Loved our good times with my family here. Will be back next year

reviews.title: Good place to have a picnic
reviews.text: The beach is a new beach in balikpapan. The location is a bit far from city centre but the scenery is nice because it has many tress in it and many food stall. The facilities is good because there many rest room and place to take showers. The beach is not so clean and many rocks in it.   People can rent buggy to go around the beach but the rent is quite pricey. The rate to get inside lamaru beach is a bit expensive but its equal with the facilities they provide.

reviews.title: Relaxing beach, ok also for children!
reviews.text: Relaxing beach, with clean water (quiet and without waves) good for swimming and having a sunny day. Near a forest of high trees (shadowing the people), the beach has a park behind, with amusement park for children (with little electric car, snack bar, playground etc.). Simply and easy to reach by little common bus or by taxi, or by motorcycle, 20 minutes far from the center of Balikpapan.

reviews.title: New Lamaru beach
reviews.text:
The place is quite busy during the weekend.
It is kept cleaned every day by the staff. 
It is quite safe. Private safety cars are patrolling regularly.
A few entertainment for kids.  
Entrance fee is quite expensive for local people but this is is also a way probably to limit their number. You got clean toilets and shower free. 
Sometimes music is quite load on speakers dispatched everywhere.

reviews.title: Good
reviews.text: Possibly the cleanest public beach in Balikpapan since the entry ticket is a little bit more expensive than the others.

reviews.title: OK beach during the week
reviews.text: The beach is crowded during the week end. the water is muddy . you will need to walk a long way to be able to swing as the water is very shallow. It is Ok to make a BBQ on the beach. Nice place to hang around during the week with friends.

reviews.title: Refresh Mind
reviews.text: Good Place for family and business, beautiful location to access the beach for vacation family gatherings

reviews.title: Beautiful beach with pine trees
reviews.text: Beach was easy to accessed, entry ticket was 20,000 per person. Pine trees decorated the beach from the way we walked into the beach to the shore line, made the beach has more shady place under the sun shine. There were other attraction in the beach location, such as banana boat, golf car, and duck boat.

reviews.title: None
reviews.text: Just a beachüòÅüòÅüòÅ. No wave, a bit dirty. Not many visitor. Lack of restaurant/sitting place. Lack games

reviews.title: very average beach
reviews.text: Dont go at low tide as you will be walking forever without getting past your neck.  Swimmers can only go as far as your waist because of the Banana Boat rides.  Water was quite hot and not very clean.  Banana boat ride was the best thing about this beach. This is primarily a muslim area and we were a group of non-muslims so we got stared at for wearing our swimmers. After being in the water our small group sat on the grass area undere trees to have a chat and a beer (we brought our own) we were approachd by many muslim family groups as they wanted to have their photo taken with uss (we were the only white people on the beach).  It was lovely and they were tickled pink to have a photo taken with us.  Other than that it was not much of a beah at all (Im used to Australian beaches).

reviews.title: i prefer the pine tree!
reviews.text:
There are some beaches in Balikpapan, but Lamaru has been said one of the best. Im not sure if I can compare this beach to other beautiful beaches in Bali, Lombok, Sulawesi, or eastern part of Indonesia, but the surrounding is definitely gorgeous. For me personally, I spent more times taking pictures among the trees, haha. 
But this beach doesnt have so much wave, so that it's perfectly safe for children. So many families visiting this beach

reviews.title: a breath of fresh air
reviews.text:
During the week, there is not much going on at Lamaru Beach, but you can still enjoy the (relatively) clean beach and the calm, shallow water.
On the weekends, however, the area springs to life with food vendors, some water sports (like banana boat rides), and you can hire a large woven mat to sit on for an hour or for the whole day. There are also golf carts for hire so you can have a ride around, and an old pony pulling a cart.
Lamaru Beach has a lovely long row of palm trees providing a shady place to sit while enjoying the sea breeze, and the public rest rooms are quite clean.

reviews.title: Bit far but nice view
reviews.text:
Bit far from balikpapan city it took more than one hour to reach this place, with plenty of coconut trees surrounding this beach with large parking area that you can acces close with edge of beach...
Some food stall you can find and you should ask how much the prices of food first before you eat...to avoid any miscomm

reviews.title: Super

Outside is also a elephant and you can ride on him.

reviews.title: Crocodile farm
reviews.text: A big disappointing, dirty, awefull s and offensive smell, sad state for the animals, better to go for boat tour to see in the wild

reviews.title: Animal abusers!
reviews.text: Disgusting animal abuse! This place shouldn‚Äôt be allowed to operate! They should be shut down immediately

reviews.title: Disgraceful abuse of animals
reviews.text:
They have a baby elephant chained, far from his habitat.
Why is this place allowed to keep an endangered, very intelligent & social species in such horrendous conditions!?

reviews.title: Crocodile Farming
reviews.text: Visitors must pay for entry tickets, Rp 25000 per person. The parking area is quite large. Visitors can't see the crocodiles directly because they were placed behind high walls. Visitors, with height below 150 cm, can't see inside the walls, better forget it to visit this place

reviews.title: Good way to break up the holiday
reviews.text: Went with my girlfriend and her family, good place with little warungs and stalls inside, can ride elephant and feed crocodiles for 30,000rp riding elephants and 10,000rp to feed the crocodiles some chicken. Safe for people of all ages, I would recommend that they clean the animal cages more frequently

reviews.title: Poor crocs
reviews.text: Not so good. Very very small and dirty. Less attraction. Too many crocs inside one place. I think the crocs dont feel comfie

reviews.title: Crocodile farm
reviews.text:
Fine,  we can see different types of crocodiles, most of them over packed in different boxes. 
However, the place is not well maintained and direction to reach it is not clear.

reviews.title: Terrible Sneak Out Day
reviews.text: the environment was terrible, poor crocodiles live there. Dirty pond and im not sure with the freshness of crocodile satay there. the taste also terrible

reviews.title: Unacceptable animal life condition
reviews.text:
Going also there with local people from balikpapan...you can see straight away, after the entrance office fee, a little field with 2 chained elephants. They both can't move freely. We can see their chained legs are sore. Asking the guy "looking after them" if they have water: "yes at night!"

We keep going to crocodile farm who is actually a VERY SMALL PARK smelling definitely not good. WHY? Because the entire park is not maintained. 
¬†¬†¬† - All walls and safety gates are VERY OLD and almost ready to fell over. NOT SAFE FOR KIDS...LOOK AFTER YOUR CHILDREN.
¬†¬†¬† - Conditions of detention: all enclosures are small. Sometimes maybe 20 massive crocodiles in a little enclosure. Sometimes 3 massives in 6m square. Some enclosures have¬† around 40 babies...definitely not enough space to make them happy and free to grow up. The water is never changed and full of rubbish, empty plastic bottles, peanuts plastic bag, tyres...sometimes kind of wooden construction with still nails on it.
¬†¬†¬† - Apparently you can try/taste crocodile. !!DON'T!! HYGIENE IS NOT RESPECTED. It's smelling so strong and the place where they do/prepare it, is opened and literally next to the crocodiles enclosure.
¬†¬†¬† - NO guides to explain you the site and about crocodiles.
¬†¬†¬† - At the exit they sell some "crocodile oil" apparently good for skin!! WHAT ARE THEY REALLY DOING WITH CROCODILES???
    - You can also see Peacock, little monkey, kind of eagles, and a big bird in cage! With no water, never cleaned, rubbishes, not enough space to move. The peacock is very aggressive, monkeys are looking/waiting for care and affection. And one of the birds is looking disfigured probably by himself coz of the life condition! 

IF YOU HAVE A HEART...DONT GO THERE, DON'T WASTE MONEY BUT ABOVE ALL...DON'T GIVE YOUR MONEY TO THIS PEOPLE WHO DON'T RESPECT ANIMALS.

reviews.title: Croco crocodiles...
reviews.text:
For persons who wants to see something different, you may come to this place.
At this place you may see crocodiles that we know live in wild become in natural cage.
You can feed them with dead chicken, as the keeper and you have to pay 10 thousands rupiah each. Throw the chicken and all the crocodiles that you might think they are sleeping, you will know you are so wrongg.. hahaha..
The crocodiles will move just so fast to eat that chicken!
rrrr.. creepy.. hehee..
If you like a challenge culinary, you could try "Sate Buaya" (*read: crocodiles meat)
The place is an hour driving from Balikpapan, could be 2 hours if there is traffic.
There is a transportation service you may contact, +6281351856899 (Mario)

reviews.title: Jurassic park
reviews.text:
When visit Balikpapan don't forget go to teritip crocodile zoo which you will back to stone centuries with thousands crocodile live there you can see from baby crocodiles until the giant ones
Recommended for family but don't forget to provide with umbrella or mask to coverage heat from sun and stink from crocodiles

reviews.title: Learn a few things about crocodiles and see them by yourself
reviews.text:
It's a bit outside the city town. You'll need 45-60 minutes to get there by car without getting lost. My second time going there, I still got lost!
They have better arrangement now, compare to the first time I visit this place.
You can wander around with local guide that will help you explaining and answering your questions.
They don't charge you, but any tip will be welcome if you think the guide is helpful.
You will learn many kind of crocodiles and they are separated by age.
Some of them are in special cage ready to be your Croc's satay.
Yes, they sell crocodile satay (I didn't taste it, tho).
You can also feed the crocodiles by buying dead chicken and throw it to them.
Surround the area you can see some other animals like monkey, turtles, and elephants. But unfortunately they are not in their best condition.
Maybe bad care, bad sanitation or poor financial problem?
But you should at least visit this place when you go to Balikpapan.

reviews.title: Not exactly a farm
reviews.text: It's just a place where crocs are cramped inside tiny pools and nothing more. More appropriate title would be crocodile cages.

reviews.title: Great Place but Bad Management
reviews.text: Crocodile Farm is one of spot in Balikpapan. To Reach this place need 45 min and my suggest using taxi or rent car or using private accommodation. You can see attraction from Elephant but I really sad to watching that animal condition (bound in chains). Or watching monkey or snake. But main attraction in here are crocodile. You can see Muara Crocodile or the others. You can enjoy food with crocodile meat as food stuff.

reviews.title: Very sad to see..
reviews.text: Crocodiles in little ponds. It's overpopulated and sad to see. The elephants are chained and don't have much room to move. Please don't visit this place and contribute to this torture.

reviews.title: A must visit object
reviews.text: I visited the Teritip Crocodile Farm on last Friday (6th May) with my family. It was one of the knowledgable object when you visit Balikpapan. The distance is approximately 45mnts from the central town. Worthed location to visit and you can see crocodiles in different ages and sizes. For those who visit with children please always take care of them eventhough the crocodiles are already protected in cages. Only small and local warung available there, and local persons sell the peanuts, corn, crocodile satay, crocodile oil and souvenirs.

reviews.title: Crocodiles
reviews.text: Not far from the city n first time for me to see the huge crocodile. East borneo also famous with the crocodile n here wr can see kind of them...goid place tk visitüëçüëçüëç

reviews.title: poor; sad, frustrating; animal torture; DO NOT VISIT

not worth to visit. Very sad facilities. Crocodiles of all sized are kept in small concrete enclosures surrounding my high walls. Only the larger ones are kept in muddy natural pools. 

This place should be shut down.

reviews.title: Green and clean

Bring a long your friends and relatives and have fun in this mangrove forest. For entering the forest you must first contact or visit the guard house, which placed in front of the tracks gate. Give approximately 10k rupiah per person as a charge to entering the forest.

reviews.title: Fresh
reviews.text: I like having a walk in here. There is a path in between the mangrove. Have some chairs for ppl rest and chats

reviews.title: HIdden treasure in the city
reviews.text:
This place is like a hidden treasure in the city.
Located only 15 minutes by car from the city center, you' ll be wowed by the quiet mangrove forest.
It has a wooden bridge along the forest,make it easier to walk and see around.
Only +/- 800 meters long, you''ll enjoy your visit.
You can see variety of small crabs with colorful claw and some birds.
There is no fee to enter this area, but usually some local lady will ask you for entrance fee (for maintenance, she said), tho she won't give you any tickets. Just ask her for tickets if she ask your money, or you can give her small money if you don't mind.

reviews.title: Very enjoyable few hours
reviews.text: Guide spoke very little english so we didn't get a lot of information but the boat trip was great and we saw lots of proboscis monkeys. Guide stopped, reversed and repositioned the boat so we would get the best view and photo opportunities. Loved it and would recommend it to all visitors.

reviews.title: Green and serene, guides helped us see bekantan!
reviews.text:
Having booked a car through our hotel, it was easy to get there - our driver just took us there!

It is a beautiful green location and obviously well looked after - very clean.  In fact wedding photos were being taken when we arrived!

We enjoyed the trip in the boat on the water with our guides - so close to the mangroves - we saw birds, amphibious fish and of course bekantan!

reviews.title: amazing kul de sak
reviews.text: Green and serenity, that's all in my mind when crossing this wonderful spot. The air so fresh, and only a few minutes from city center. Must be visited when you go to Balikpapan.

reviews.title: Nice and good garden
reviews.text: Its one nicest place if you are in balikpapan,due to this garden very peaceful. The acces is very secret from town. And It looks good garden in balikpapan but the gate is locked however dont worry there is phone number on the board beside the gate,just call the number and wait 10 minutes it will be open by a women who live there . Actually its free but i suggest you to pay as sincere cause it is for help economic. At the first time i was lucky! Cause i saw bekantan and crocodille cause rarely they out from the garden. The little bridge was long now and looks cool. I suggest you for visit this place

reviews.title: Secret garden
reviews.text:
This place looks like secret garden.. good place to take photos with your friends.. 

Although some people said there is Bekantan live there, i dont see bekantan anyway ~ 

1-1.5 hour trip :)

This place is locked away, you'll find number near the gate.. just call and someone will open it.. it's free..

reviews.title: Nice place to visit
reviews.text:
It's one of the nicest places to visit in balikpapan for an foreigner. But there is not much to do in balikpapan. It's a normal indonesian road which leads there. Little bit bumpy. Good accessible by car or taxi. A bit tricky to find the entrance. You need to call a number at the gate to get in. Indonesian essential.  We did it with our taxi driver.  For the taxi way to +waiting +return we paid all in all 170.000 rp . Entrance for 2 ppl is 50.000 rp. However you can have 2 km return nice board walk. We saw mangrove trees , crabs, little fish's, monkeys etc. ... no mosqitos :) 

Information are only in indonesian. It seems that all comments in tripadvisor are from indonesians in english. I am sure it will look different at low / high tide or different day times. We went there at noon at low tide.

Rubbish around as everywhere indonesia.

All in all it was okay but the best thing to do in balikpapan.

reviews.title: Jungle trekking
reviews.text: You need to use a car to get there. Access is not the best. The way is quite bumpy to say the least, but worth the pain for a little juggle adventure. (Also go to the sunbear reservation along the way)

reviews.title: lots of nature
reviews.text: We were serenaded by bird song, whistles, pops, squawks and sibilant scribbles, but could we see them? No ‚Äì save the occasional Imperial Pigeon overhead and a Pacific Swallow which followed us up river. But it was beautiful ‚Äì and wild. This is the haunt of the fearsome estuarine crocodile of the Indo-Pacific, which can grow over 20 feet long.

reviews.title: a maze
reviews.text: The entrance was quite tricky, after we find it, along side the path many place where people live but not good for drainase. It was not good for visitor to see, i mean they need help.

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: We went there just before dawn to catch Bekantan monkeys. Not many but the hunt was fun. Fantastic experience.

reviews.title: eco tourism
reviews.text: its a mangrove forest one of the place you should see when you visit Balikpapan,try to go on the wooden path along the forest and see the beautiful mangroves and the small colourful crabs and other creatures its so exiting.

reviews.title: Love the nature
reviews.text: one of the most exciting place in Balikpapan (if you like nature) is margomulyo mangrove forest. I like to go on the wooden path along the forest and see the beautiful mangroves and the creature below it (crabs)

reviews.text: tempat ini bagus banget buat wisata edukasi, tapi sayang kurang sekali informasi nya karena sempat bingung tempat masuknya dari mana.

name: Sun Bear Education and Conservation Center
ranking_subcategory: #2 of 39 things to do in Balikpapan

ranking: #2 of 39 things to do in Balikpapan
description: Kawasan Wisata Pendidikan Lingkungan Hidup (KWPLH), which translates to Environmental Education and Recreation facility, or colloquially also known as the Sun Bear Center, is an environmental education facility located 23 km north of Balikpapan in East Kalimantan, Indonesian Borneo. In 2002, the Sun Bear was proposed as the mascot of Balikpapan, fuelled by the first research project on wild sun bears carried out in the field in the Sungai Wain Protection Forest located without Balikpapan City boundaries. Since 2004, the City Government has collaborated with private donors and wildlife experts to develop the sun bear education center, the centerpiece of which is a 1.3 ha natural enclosure housing 7 sun bears that can never be released into the wild. This is enclosure is widely recognized as one of the best of its kind in Asia, and increasing numbers of tourists (70,000 in 2013), domestic and foreign, can see the mascot of Balikpapan in a natural environment. In 2008, a Sun Bear information exhibit, the largest and most comprehensive of its kind in Asia, was opened at the Centre, followed by an education exhibit focusing on Domestic animal care versus Wildlife not suitable as pets. In 2014 a new exhibit focusing on the rich Endemic Flora and Fauna of Borneo was opened. Plans are under way to develop further exhibits with environmental themes, such as the different ecosystems and their functions from mountains to the sea in Borneo. The Centre has also developed a rescue facility for stray and abandoned cats and dogs, also providing the public with information on pet care. In addition, over the years, attractive gardens and outward bound facilities have been developed, and visitor numbers have increased steadily. The majority of visitors are local schoolchildren, community groups and families wanting to escape the hustle and bustle of the city for a few hours. To date the site developments have largely been funded through donations, while the basic running costs have been funded by the city government. The site currently employs 41 staff, 80% of whom are from local communities.
address: Jl. Soekarno-Hatta Km. 23 no. 185 RT. 42 Kelurahan Karang Joang, Balikpapan 76127 Indonesia

reviews.title: What a pleasant place for education
reviews.text: This tourist attraction is very fun but not just a fun place but there was a lot of information that can educate us. In this place there was so many of information that u can see wherever you are, which is it‚Äôs good so beside we can see the animal we also can learn something new and get more knowledge. Although i had visited this place when i was in kindergarten but i still remember how this place looked like because it‚Äôs so memorable and I really enjoyed. If we visit this place of course we want to see the sun bear and we can see the sun bear at a considerable distance but we still can see the sun bear clearly but there also place for people can see directly the sun bear and the guides who will help us to see everything in this place.  Beside a place where we can see the sun bear they also have another place such as souvenir center, play ground, dining area, and a lamin house. This is a fun place and if i can get a chance to visit this place again then I would like to visit.

reviews.title: Such an Amazing Experience
reviews.text:
This place is one of my favorite places, it provides a lot of things and knowledge that can be obtained, even though it takes about an hour to get to this place. 

Sun bears are protected animals in this place, when we arrive we will be directed by their guides to see everything. From sun bears until flora and fauna information centers. In this place they also provide a souvenir center, dining area, flower gardens, playgrounds, and a lamin house that can be used for documentary film shows, educational panel appearances, and other events. One of the most enjoyable things is we can see directly the sun bear doing their activities such as eat, roam around, and even sleep. 

If I had another chance to visit this place after this pandemic I would spend more time enjoying their amazing places and explore more about sun bears. I recommend you to visit this place in the morning or evening. based on my own experience, at that time I went in the middle of the day so it made me feel hotter and drained a lot of energy to explore this place. 

You must visit this place! And share your experience.

reviews.title: Must Visit!
reviews.text: It tooks almost an hour to get there but it's all worth it! I get the chance to see the bears coming out from the forest and eating their foods. Best experience ever!

reviews.title: Really good day out!
reviews.text: Its an amazing place that i would highly recommend to anyone in the area! We stayed for 3-4hours, there was plenty to do!

reviews.title: As important as the Organutan Center
reviews.text: This is definitely worth a visit. We knew nothing about the sun bears before we arrived and learnt a lot whilst there. It was great to see all the hard work the team there are doing.

reviews.title: Enjoyable visit
reviews.text: The centre is informative and well looked after. The bears seemed to be relaxed and cared for and We saw many of them. I would have liked to have known more about the individual bears. The centre can be visited at the same time as a visit to the orangutans and both can be seen in half a day.

reviews.title: Important to give support
reviews.text: Fabulous place to visit. They do an amazing job. So many rescued bears! They have a great area to live in, with loads of room and a French man who is a permanent volunteer who cares greatly for them. Thank heaven for people like him.

reviews.title: Amazing to see and experience
reviews.text: We flew in just for the day to visit the Orangatans and Sun Bears - they are within walking distance of each other. The bears can be hard to spot but when you do it is very exciting. You walk around the conservation area on raised platforms. It is very well presented and a great experience to see the smallest bears in the world.

reviews.title: An incredibly informative education centre!
reviews.text:
If ever passing through Balikpapan, East Kalimantan I recommend you to experience this Sun Bear Education & Conservation Centre (KWPLH) that's set on quite a large property outside of the city limits. The first and only education centre in the whole of Kalimantan!

A great spot for a weekend picnic with family or friends and an opportunity to learn more about Balikpapan's mascot - the sun bear. The naturalised enclosure for the sun bears have raised boardwalks around most of the area that allows viewing from above, especially during feeding time which is always a great opportunity for photos. The guides that work at the centre are very enthusiastic, passionate, and articulate with educating the general public about the sun bears and the conservation issues that they face. Lots of effort has gone into the environmental education exhibits throughout the property on; sun bears, endemic flora and fauna of Borneo, and domestic animals.

There is also a small vet clinic and adoption centre for domestic animals that are being looked after on the property also. An important initiative to educate the public about being responsible pet owners. An insightful experience!

reviews.title: Great place to see, unique
reviews.text: Great place to see! Very interesting and unique place to see, excellent exhibion for pblic about nature, unique place to see bears rescued from terrible conditions. Go to the Sungai Wain forest for trekking too, they will give you the contact. Unique cat and dog shelter.

reviews.title: Fresh air, learning centre, donation
reviews.text: This place is an integrated education centre for Sun Bear. You can have getaway trip here in this place, with a lot of trees, the local Dayak building and education centre about Sun Bear

reviews.title: informative
reviews.text: This centre is a good place to find information about sun bear. It's informative, clean, good for kid.

reviews.title: More improvement needed
reviews.text:
There are not many location in East Kalimantan which designated as sun bear conservation center. This is one of it. This conservation center received and helped sun bear who had been caught or hunted by people. Sometimes also sun bear who run out due to their forest had been converted become palm plantation. There are some good information provided here about sun bear. Unlike zoo, the surroundings of this place is kept as natural as possible, thus the sun bears can adapt to their original forest with limited interface with humans. 

You need to come at 9 am in the morning to see them during feeding time. Out of that time, it will be difficult since they may be inside. More improvement and facilities maintenance needed for some attractions here. 

They have a big hall where you can use for gatherings, etc. This place also good for arranging outdoor activities.

reviews.title: Not worth to be here twice
reviews.text: It will open at 12 noon and 3 pm to look at the bear.. and it seems very limited bear and the place is not comfortable for kiddo.. there's a bear museum you can look at any kind of information about the bear.. it's quite clean but I will definitely not be here twice..

reviews.title: Good to support but very average
reviews.text: This was my second visit to the site. Its a bit rundown and apart from viewing the sun bears twice a day when they get feed there isnt alot else to see or do. Its quite a distance from Balikpapan and worth seeing and supporting but I dont think I will visit again. At the time we went there were busloads of schoolkids so it was very busy. The walking and viewing platforms are very narrow so it was a bit of a crush and viewing was not easy for the small kids we had with us. They only have two viewings a day at 9am and 3pm so you need to get there early. We wandered around the grounds and the kids played on the playground equipment however much of it was in a bad state of disrepair and quite frankly, dangerous so they couldnt enjoy the facilities. There wasnt much more to do there.

reviews.title: Great information centre and enclosure
reviews.text:
This centre is very well presented and attended. The information centre is interesting, and pavilions are beautiful and have helpful staff, speaking English as well. The enclosure for the sun bears is impressive, as they have such strong claws and could tear fences down easily. Not welcome out in the villages, these now socialised individuals have to remain in captivity. We walked along a bridge to a pile of old tree branches, where keepers had hidden fruit and painted honey. Immediately on release from their dens, the bears animatedly searched the area to retrieve all the fruits.
I enjoyed seeing the bears in a good quality enclosure and looking very healthy at a safe distance. Well done to the Foundation who created and maintain this place!

reviews.title: Refresh ROARRR!!!
reviews.text: Nice spot not to far away from hustle and bustle of city life. Love the fresh air & some info on sun bear. Just make sure you come before 9am or 3pm when they feed the bears....roarrrrr..

reviews.title: Not much thing to do
reviews.text: Remember to watch their schedule. But even when u on their feeding time, i am sorry to say, it still boring for me.

reviews.title: One Fine Spot to Bring Your Family
reviews.text: We visited this spot, initially, because of my little sister's love for the bears. :) Well, I do not regret to ever visited it. I love the forestry & natural nuance surrounds, while we can enjoy everything it offers; from the walk on the bridge, and relaxing in the traditionally-designed bulding. They have cats to be adopted, too!

reviews.title: Visit the Bears
reviews.text: It is very interesting but i found you need to be there before 9.00am as that is when they feed the bears and the guides tell you lots of very interesting information on the Sun Bears. Good trip for children as great learning centre as well

reviews.title: Local Heroes
reviews.text:
What an amazing experience, explored the mangroves on the boat and met some of the most inspirational heroes who have worked hard in educating the local and the world about how important mangroves are for us and the planet. We met Pak Agus and his friends. Wow...I am super impressed to his substantial knowledge about Mangroves in general and how genuine he is in trying to protect the mangroves here. 

These guys are super heroes...feel really grateful to meet them and hearing their stories üíöüåè

We saw a few proboscis monkeys out and about.

it's a must place to go...

reviews.title: Nice and close
reviews.text: Nice area close to Balikpapan; Good for a short visit while staying in the city. We saw proboscis monkeys around

reviews.title: Mangrove center balikpapan
reviews.text: If u wanna see beautifull bekantan jumping from one tree to another tree so come n see the mangrove center of balikpapan...so beautifull sight seeing...seems like in small amazone river...not too far from the city its inside of the housing complex  ut very beutifull inside...

reviews.title: To-Do in Balikpapan
reviews.text:
Astonishing mangrove forest which is managed and self-funded by local community at Graha Indah, Balikpapan. I was impressed by the calibre of the air in the forest - it was fresh and cooling you down from the heat of the city. I met Bapak Agus Bei - the founder of the forest and got new knowledge about mangrove and Bekantan from both Bapak Agus Bei and Bapak Herman - my skipper.
I would say it is a To-Do in Balikpapan. To support the local community and to support maintaining mangrove and Bekantan.

reviews.title: Good knowledge
reviews.text: Failed to see Bekantan, they usually showed up very early in the morning and 3 pm in thr afternoon. We went there about 9.30 am - 11 am. The children (we went there to guide elementary students to explore) got a good explanation about plants and animals in mangrove area.

reviews.title: enjoying the boat in the forest
reviews.text: Located in Gg. mangrove VI  Graha Indah Residence, you can reach from Balikpapan to Samarinda road km 5. Turn left and keep the road until you find Graha Indah Residence 2. rent a boat price is Rp. 300.000 for max 6 people. The trip will take around 1hour. You'd better come in the morning or afternoon around 2-5 pm before sunset. Low tide usually around 11-13 pm, and the boat can not be used. Contact person : Pak Agus (081350371500)

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.text: mangrove forest in Graha Indah turned out to be very large, visitors can get around the forest by renting a boat with approximately 1 hour, we will find typical Kalimantan animals namely "Bekantan‚Äù a kind of monkey but a long-nosed icon that becomes the icon Ancol Jakarta.

reviews.title: The closest place to see proboscis Monkey in east Kalimantan
reviews.text: We have seen the swimming Proboscis Monkey when l was guiding Italian guests, best time to do the tour is at 7 in the morning , all proboscis seems going close to river side to have their morning breakfast, dont be surprised if you see the "master" , big and lazzy probos , cool place !

reviews.title: The one and only Proboscis
reviews.text:
It‚Äôs recommended to go there first time in the morning or at the afternoon right before sunset; because the Proboscis can not stand the heat of the sun üåû ‚òÄÔ∏è 
Beautiful river and mangrove complete the scenery; and I personally suggest you to bring your binoculars so you can see the proboscis clearly ad they are very shy mammals

reviews.title: Amazing to see the proboscis monkeys and mangroves!!
reviews.text: Our guide was very nice and he kindly taught us a lot about both the mangroves and the monkeys. We couldn't find the monkeys straight away but our guide said that its the most important part of the trip so wouldn't go back before we had seen them.

reviews.title: Memorable mangrove and proboscis monkey trip
reviews.text: We went in a flat bottomed aluminium boat, with quiet outboard motor, and from the beginning, this experience was fascinating. As the tide was low, we touched the bottom a few times meandering through the dense, gnarled mangrove roots and lush vegetation. It felt a bit like a primal forest, with mud skippers along the muddy banks. There were a few fishermen there, but no-one else. We looked at a proboscis monkey colony near the mouth of the river, where a few coal barges and cargo vessels were moored, before heading back to the centre. This only took an hour!

reviews.title: Afternoon trip at Mangrove
reviews.text:
I've ever been in Nusa Lembongan, Bali and visited the mangrove there.
The Mangrove Center Graha Indah is the most beautiful mangrove center I've ever been.
The best time you go there is arround 2-3 p.m. Rent a boat that will take you around the Mangrove. You may hear sound of animals there, and you may also see a crocodile :D.. So don't put your hand into the water.. hehee..
The trip will be around 2-3 hours.. When the sun set, the star of the mangrove kalimantan, "Bekantan" will be at the end of the trip.
Bekantan is one of the monkey spesies with big nose and long tail.
They are protected animals.
ENJOY your time with families for education, or friends to consider the nature to be loved.

P.S. You can contact +6281351856899 (Mario) for transportation service, just like what I did with my friends.

reviews.title: Better than we hoped
reviews.text:
Difficult to locate the place in the first instance, but once found it was a memorable trip. It cost 300,000rp to hire a boat with outboard motor and a guide. He said it would be half an hour but it was much more. You're taken through the mangroves - spooky places - and eventually the river opened out and there were forests on either side. After seeing some rustling leaves high up in the trees we slowly approached and were surprised to see many proboscis monkeys jumping from tree to tree and screeching as they did. Further on a similar thing happened. It was not easy to get pictures as they were so quick but I managed one. We were told that there were crocodiles around but we didn't see any. Apparently they are not interested in human flesh, but like to go for the monkeys when they venture into the water.
Great experience.

reviews.title: A pretty good first experience of seeing Bekantan
reviews.text:
The place is in a residential complex with quite clear signs once you enter the residential area, so it was not hard to find. Booking was easy with just an sms sent to the founder's number. I don't think booking is necessary though because they have a few boats and can just take anyone walking in - unless they are serving big groups.
They charge per boat (IDR 300K), so it's better not to take the ride alone. If you're going solo, you can ask if you can join another group so you can share the cost. 
The whole boat ride was pretty short (about 1 hour) and the guide I had did not explain much unless I asked him questions. I did see some Bekantans on the trees and it was pretty cool. The guide would stop the boat a bit longer at the spots where we could see Bekantans.
Don't forget to bring a mosquito repellent spray / lotion because the mosquitos are pretty crazy. They told me the best times to do it in the morning (7-ish am) and in the afternoon (4pm-ish). These are the times when the Bekantans are out for food so you have bigger chances of spotting them.

reviews.title: Refreshing Mangrove Tour!
reviews.text: It was a worthy 45-60 minutes boat trip through the mangroves. Although we went there on a cloudy day, we enjoyed very much the cool breeze while seeing Bekantan

reviews.title: Perfect late afternoon trip
reviews.text: I am sure this place is the best thing to visit in Balikpapan. It's such a pleasant and peaceful place. I really enjoyed the boat trip and I was able to see many proboscis monkeys. I do recommend this place, but you should go there in the late afternoon.

reviews.title: Enjoyable educational boat trip
reviews.text: Not that cheap, but very worth spending, especially considering that some of the fee is utilized for mangrove forest conservation effort by the locals. The boat trip costs 300 thousand rups. The service provider is friendly and helpful. They'll do their best to make sure that you see the proboscis monkey during the trip. Family is very welcomed. However, they provide only adult sized life jackets. Bring your own for your kids.

reviews.title: Peaceful escape near center of Balikpapan City
reviews.text:
This tourism object is at Graha Indah Housing Complex. Around 30 minutes from the center of Balikpapan City. But as far as I know there is no public transport to this place. 
The best time to come here is at afternoon around 3pm - 5pm. You can see the mangrove from a wood tower and rent the boat to see the mangrove center conservation area. The rental cost of a boat is around IDR 300000, a boat is enough for 10 person. So if you want cheaper price, it is better to go in group rather than alone.
The guide will tell you all about mangrove and its ecosystem. And if you are lucky, you can see "Bekantan Monkey" in group at the mangrove/riverside.
I came to this place three times. At that time we can see groups of Bekantan swimming accross the mangrove area.

reviews.title: Nice place to go
