description: Borneo, the land to adventure the Unspoiled Jungle, the Great Ape of Orangutan, and the Mystical Culture of Dayak People. This world‚Äôs third largest island covers an area about 747.000 sq km, home of amazing plants and animals, such as; the rare black orchid, iron wood, gigantic dipterocarp tree, raflessia flower, the carnivorous pitcher plant, orangutans, proboscis monkey, gibbon, hornbill, etc.
address: Jl. SMP n samarinda sebrang, Balikpapan Indonesia

reviews.title: I can't wait to go back
reviews.text:
My partner and I reserved a 5D4N jungle tour. Budi, our tour guide, met us at the airport. We took a short taxi to the boat where we had fried plantains and drinks waiting for us. We met the captain, assistant captain, and cook who would be accompanying us on the journey. 

The crew stayed on the bottom deck which is also where the bathroom is. We stayed on the top level of the boat (which has a mattress, table, and mosquito nets).  The top deck is open air, but impromptu shutters are made using tarps when it rains. 
The open air top deck gives you amazing views of the jungle, river and wild-life. 

Budi gave an overview of our itinerary as we started our 1.5hr boat ride to the first camp. There are three camps, and each day we went to one or more of them. 

The first day we trekked 4hrs in the jungle with the ranger and Budi. The trek is typically for longer stays. The trail was fairly flat with some large puddles and slippery portions. We travelled in Oct/Nov which is the shoulder season so we had rain once a day. The rains cooled down the air which made the hike very enjoyable. While we hiked, Budi and the ranger told us about local plants and wildlife. We took a speedboat canoe back to the boat. The canoe is low to the water so we saw great views.  This was one of our favorite parts of the trip.

Once we got back to the boat, lunch was waiting for us. The food was amazing and we had many different kinds of fruit with each meal. She made us authentic Indonesian food with less spice. 

Later in the day, we went to the viewing station to see the Orangutans. We spent 2hrs watching them eat and interact. It's truly amazing experience to see them. We saw close to 10-15 orangutans. Some of them would come very close. 

The next three days, we would travel and dock at the other two camps. The third camp seems to be the most established. One our last full day, we went to two camps. In the second and third camps, we saw more wild orangutans, macaques, lemurs, bats, and even a crocodile. 

We could not have been more grateful for the adventure. We highly recommend bringing hiking boots, mosquito spray (2 bottles), light-weight pants, a backpack, and a light rain jacket for trekking. If you are not trekking, we still recommend those items along with flip-flops and shorts for larger puddles. We also recommend bringing cash to tip the crew. We also appreciated carrying some body wipes.

reviews.title: The best experience!
reviews.text: We booked the 4D3N orangutan tour and it exceeded our expectations! We could not recommend this tour enough. Everything was perfectly organized and managed by our expert guide Dani, and all his crew. He knew everything and anything, answered all our questions and constantly made us laugh by imitating different monkey noises. Also, the traditional Indonesian food was exceptional. This is a must do experience with an exceptional company. This will forever stay in our hearts.

reviews.title: MUST DO!
reviews.text:
Great experience, the boat crew were amazing. We enjoyed the 4D3N Orangutan tour, would highly recommend this!

This adventure included, bugs, sweat and getting wet but that just made the onboard shower even better!

reviews.title: Jungle trek and wild orangutan 8 days
reviews.text:
We lived a wonderful experience. The tour was beyond any expectation..deep jungle trek in amazing Meratus Mountains, floating market in Banjarmasin, Orangutan Island, Sebangau National park (where we searched for orangutans in flooded jungle and we found them!) and so much more! 
The team did an excellent job! Everything was perfectly organized and managed by Adie (who was very helpful even before the tour giving us a lot of usefull information) Sys, our guide, Agys, our driver and all the guys we met!
We will always keep this very wild adventure in our hearts.

reviews.title: Excellent adventure through beautiful forests
reviews.text:
We booked the 4 day, 3 night tour with BEA, and didn't have a single regret! 

Risma was warm and welcoming and answered emails and messages very quickly, and provided excellent guidance on not only the best tour options for us, but also suggested flight bookings and more information beyond just the tour. 

The tour itself was perfectly organised, we had our guide, Monica waiting to pick us at the airport. An excellent captain navigated us to different parts of tanjung puting national park. The boat assistant and cook were also amazing, efficiently managing the boat and served up amazing, simple yet delicious food. 

Monica shared so much history and context to the land and it's courageous people, and we spotted many wild organgutans and proboscis monkeys and even different birds along the way. We walked to different feeding stations to watch rehabilitated Orangutans at feeding time, and had a lovely walk through some beautiful forest with Udin, a local Ranger. We planted trees at Pesalat, and spent time with the Ranger Pedan there. 

We appreciated a few specific things that made this trip really, really special: 

1. our boat captain NEVER chased down any animal we spotted, and in fact turned off the engine so we could observe the animals without disturbing them.

 2. The boat was super clean and well maintained, and all our trash was collected in bins (and not dumped in the river!) 

3. All the staff maintained all SOPs and told us clearly about dos and don'ts. 

4. The tour groups have been slowly buying land on the river bank opposite the national park to ensure palm oil companies don't take over EVERY tiny bit of land available. 

5. This tour helps, supports and benefits locals (including and especially women), helping boost the local economy and preventing outmigration, which allows them to keep at their efforts to preserve and conserve the forests. 

6. The staff are paid well and fairly. 

Definitely recommend this tour because i noticed at least one other tour boat (and two guides) chasing and disturbing animals to please their tourist. We also saw these two guides walking barefoot in the forest (against SOPs) and disturbing the Orangutans. 

We were honoured to have met and talked with various people like rangers, and our guide and boat staff who loved and respected their work and the ongoing conservation efforts. 

Oh, and as a bonus, we spotted a river dolphin right at the end of our tour!

reviews.title: Borneo ancien Karst and Orangutans tour
reviews.text:
We did the the Borneo ancien Karst and Orangutans in family in January 2020, and this was really an excellent Adventure ! 

Before the tour itself, Adie from Borneo eco Adventure team, was really reactive during our emails exchange and answered all my questions with clarity and kindness. He suggested also places to go on Maratua Island alter the tour.

The tour itself was really great, perfectly organized, and as per the planned program. We have seen all the animals we dreamt to see, orangutans, probiscis monkeys, hornbill, tarentulas,...  

But what made the tour so brilliant was our guide and driver, Yansa and Ossay. They were really friendly, competent, safe and great cooks ! They took care of us perfectly, and always with a smile! Yansa has become a friend to the whole family and we thank him a lot for this great adventure !

Our kids of 10, 8 and 6 were really pleased with the jungle treks, duration and effort. The accommodations and meals were fine, specially the night in tent next to the Nyadeng lake ! The only drawback was sometimes the duration of the car transfer between the sites, but this gives the opportunity to see a lot of Kalimantan.

I would highly recommend this tour and the team at Borneo Eco Adventure !

reviews.title: the real borneo life
reviews.text:
Beautiful places.
Organization and kindness of excellent guides.
Far from the usual western routes.
To try!!!!!!!!!

reviews.title: It really is an adventure
reviews.text: We booked the ‚ÄúCross Borneo Trekking‚Äù. I had found them on the internet but there where no reviews about this trekking. I found some but they where more then 10 years old. So we finally just booked because the owner was so kind and answered al my questions almost imedeately and we where looking for a trip off the beaten track.We had an English speaking guide who picked us up at the airport. The next day we flew to Putussibau where we met the rest of the crew. The next day we left by boat with two guides (one who spoke English, one who knew the route) and a crew of two boatmen and 4 porters. After 2 days on the river we started the real trekking. The 2 boatmen left, took the boat back (against the current) and we had to carry our stuff in our backpacks for the next days. Luckily some of the porters took some heavy things from our backpacks. Every night we stoped at about 4 o‚Äôclock to build the next camp. The porters and guids made a fire place and cooked the best meals, some days we had fresh fish from the river. We crossed the river a lot of times and sometimes the current was very strong so we had to build a human chain to cross savely. Unfortunately we had very bad weather almost all day it rained very heavily so the rivers where strong and deep. Luckily we bought some simple rubber shoes on the market in Putussibau because our expensive water shoes were way to slippery.Becaus of the weather we needed an extra day to reach the destination and after a quiet scary last trip we reached this lovely little town. We met some people who where on a business trip, my boyfriend talked to them and they where leaving with a super fast boat to the next bigger city from where some car took us to the airport just in time to take a shower in the Hotel sleep 2 hours and catch the plane home. The whole trekking trip we really did not meet other people. It was extremely heavy and you really need some experience. But if you dare, JUST DO IT!The crew was great and some of them sometimes send pictures, still now after 1,5 years. I would not do it again but it absolutely is a trip I will never forget and we are proud we did this.Our trip was in August of 2017.

reviews.title: Kutai National Park
reviews.text: We booked the 5days Kutai National Park Tour via Borneo Eco Adventures and we were more than happy. Our assigned guide Nurul perfectly guided us through the whole tour although being sick herself! She is such a friendly happy and inspiring person! Adie from Borneo Eco Adventure made sure no wishes were left open for us. He even considered our wish to have a vegetarian diet (which is not always easy in Borneo) and frequently talked to our guide about the progress of our tour! We felt save all the time and they really took great care of us! Exactly what we were hoping for a good price! You get what you book so don‚Äòt expect any luxury, but this wasn‚Äôt anything we were seeking for. Adie was prior to our trip in permanent contact with us answering patiently and always friendly all our major and minor questions (and we had a loooot). Communication with this agency was great! We happily recommend them! If you want to see wild Orangutans, Prosbiotic Monkeys, Crocodiles and a bunch of nighttime Insects go for them!

reviews.title: Foreigners Not Allowed!!
reviews.text:
We tried to get into the museum twice on the one day.
The first time it appeared to be closed for prayer time (Fair enough)
But the second time, when we finally found someone who worked there, we were informed that foreigners are not allowed in, without previous approval from the local military unit!
Something they might have mentioned somewhere online, to save us the trip.

reviews.title: A museum about Balikpapan military history
reviews.text: This museum located at Kampung Baru area, not too far from Pasar Inpres Kebun Sayur (Vegetable Garden Inpres Market). Not too many people in Balikpapan know this museum. This museum is manage by Indonesian Military (Kodam Mulawarman). In this museum you can see various kind of weapon, documentation, and simple medical device that use during war at Balikpapan; and also history about Indonesian army. If you are lucky, the guide will show you a film about Indonesian History. And the most important things, at the terrace of this museum you will see two cannons. These two cannons are Australian Army Remains from the war at Balikpapan before 1945. Now the cannons already painted with green-black-brown color (Indonesian Army color).

musium
sangat cocok dikunjungi
liburan yang berkesan

reviews.title: Permata di Tengah Kota
reviews.text:
Tidak banyak warga Balikpapan yang tahu jika mereka memiliki museum militer unik di Balikpapan.

Museum ini terletak di jalan utama, tidak jauh dari Pasar kebun sayur dan  jalan sepaku (jalan masuk ke Kampung Atas Air). Denah lokasi dapat dilihat di bagian foto.

Di dalam museum kecil ini anda akan dapat menemui beberapa senjata tua asli dari mulai meriam, senjata api, senjata tajam seperti samurai, pedang dan mandau. Anda dapat juga melihat peralatan militer tua seperti alat komunikasi dan alat kesehatan.

Lalu museum ini juga dilengkapi beberapa miniatur model perlengkapan militer modern seperti Tank, Helicopter, kapal perang, dan pesawat tempur.

Bagian terbaiknya...semuanya gratis.

reviews.title: Leisure in the mall and Borneo Bay
reviews.text: Plaza Balikpapan is the first shopping mall in Balikpapan which is considered a family mall with the concept of providing all family needs in one place. This mall is known for facilities like the CGV movie theatre, Starbucks, McDonald's, Matahari, Borneo Bay, and many more. Borneo Bay, which is an apartment complex attached to the mall, is the place I often visit. The reason being my parents owning a few units in the apartment. On the other hand, I would go to Plaza Balikpapan to lounge and eat after I had helped my parents with cleaning up the apartment units. After I had eaten, I‚Äôd take a walk around the mall, which has a calmer atmosphere because it is not as crowded as E-walk or Pentacity. In contrast to the nice things about the mall, the only things that could be better is if they had more restaurants with higher qualities and more diverse stores.

reviews.title: Small mall, large crowd, backed by a huge residential complex
reviews.text: This mall has got a few landmark entrances, Starbucks, McDonald's, lady's market, Borneo bay, etc. Decide where to go and to alight accordingly. This mall has G+1+2 floors. There are other coffee shops like Excelsio, the Dunkin Donuts shop (which is good and also early in the morning at 8:30am open!!), Farmers market, etc. The complex has at the background, Borneo Bay residential complex comprising of some 800 apartments those of the residents who patronize this mall for their needs and wants. A little noisy carnival atmosphere at times at the mall by offering vendors like Vivo, Oppo, Samsung, etc. Could be regulated.

reviews.title: Mangrove Centre and Hutan Lindung Sungai Wain Half-Day Trip
reviews.text:
Ibu Nila had been a very nice tour-guide by showing us the beauty of Mangrove Centre and Hutan Lindung Sungai Wain in a half-day trip. 

Ibu Nila brought us to Mangrove Centre at 6 am in the morning, it was drizzle a little bit but she made sure we got our life jacket before hopping on the boat. She was also so friendly to my daughter, explained every detail to my 7 years-old girl patiently. During the mangrove trip using the boat, we found mud-skipper, crabs, heron, and the proboscis monkeys jumping on and off the tree's branches. We were also captivated by how mangrove reproduces using the long propagules which Ibu Nila showed to us.

Continuing the journey with a short trekking to Hutan Lindung Sungai Wain, we met more fascinating plants! We saw the great banyan tree, bajakah tree, meranti, rotan, even the rare species of Borneo black orchid. Ibu Nila showed us the pristine water source, termites nest, kelulut nest, fungi etc. We also caught a glimpse of jumping lutung merah in between the trees.

We ended the trip by resting beside the water reservoir and hade a nice landscape view. If you want to have further trekking to the forest, you can ask Ibu Nila about trekking to Jamal point. Don't forget to visit the delicious Soto Lamongan in kilo 10 fur lunch. Thank you Ibu Nila!

reviews.title: Balikpapan day tour with Nila
reviews.text: We organised a day trip around Balikpapan with Nila. I was in contact with her a few months before our trip to see if we could visit a few places I had been to in the past as I had gone to school there. She was super helpful and went out of her way to get us access to sites I wanted to see. She was very flexible and took us to places I didn't even think of. If you are in Balikpapan I definitely recommend getting a tour. It is such a wonderful city with interesting history.

reviews.title: Great tour company!
reviews.text:
Awesome trip on short notice.
We contacted Nila via WhatsApp less than 24h before we wanted to start the tour (plus it was the festive days after Ramadan). She managed to get us a guide (Jumri) who took us on a 3 day trip around Mahakam river. His English is very good and he is a great guy and organizer. We learned a lot and had a lot of fun. 
Afterwards Nila also helped us organizing our next travel (bus connections etc)

reviews.title: Once in a lifetime experiences in Kutai
reviews.text:
Nila organised for us an amazing tour to Kutai National park. The contact with her was very fast and easy. The reason we preffered Kutai National parc is because you can really see the Orang-Utangs in the wild and it's more of the beaten path. And the long journey for the two days in the jungle was so worth it. Nila organised the day before a nice tour in Balikbapan. She took us to a local sate place, which was amazing. The sunbear sanctuary wasn't really for us but we did like our boat tour through the mangrove. 
The next day we went to Kutai. 
Its a long bumpy journey to get there, but our guide Iwan and our driver Yunos tried to make it as comfortable as possible
Eventually in the jungle we were the only tourists staying at the ranger camp with Heri and Ipe our hosts. Ipe cooked amazing food and sambal and Heri was an amazing ranger. Besides the great vibe there was around the camp we saw so many orang-utangs from up close. Because the camp is build around fruit trees you even have the chance of seeing them around the camp if you're lucky like we were. I think Awang told us we had a absolute record of 17 encounters in two days.  We were very lucky and we realise you can't plan nature! That said the jungle is still an amazing place to wander through and to wake up surrounded by the sound of rain and the birds in the jungle. Heri showed us special tries, mushrooms and all kinds of insects and other animals that he spotted. He is truly a great ranger and Awang is so fun as your guide. The whole trip was amazing! 

A big thank you to Nila, Awang, Heri, Ipe & Yunos. It was a trip of lifetime!

reviews.title: AMAZING  2.5 Week trip through Kalimantan (East, South and Central)
reviews.text:
When looking into Indonesian Borneo (Kalimantan) it is certainly overwhelming. This is a vast land mass with many things to see. Nila made seeing it all seamless! From the planning phase through to the execution, Nila was active in recommendations and helping to build a trip that we would love. She worked for months with us iterating on itineraries to make sure the price and activities aligned with what we wanted. 

We worked our way from southern Kalimantan through to the East. From the beginning we were picked up from the Airport by a very professional guide and a driver. The guides throughout our trip were a wealth of knowledge who were very personable, spoke excellent English and are very genuine people. As we travelled to different provinces we met new local guides from each area that all had a unique knowledge of the region. The guides that we had through out were all amazing people and we learned so much about the culture and the way of life as well as experiencing it first hand with them. It would have been impossible to travel the full route without their expertise. 

Kalimantan has a aged infrastructure that has been overused by many industry vehicles leaving behind rough tight highways. Nila had arranged transportation throughout the trip. Each driver was confident, calm and collected along the drive. It takes an experienced driver who knows the roads day and night to travel the major distances. We felt safe in the hands of the drivers that we had. 

We also enjoyed 2 sleeper boat excursions where the crew was friendly welcoming and all around great to travel with. They all had strong relationships with Nila and took great care of us. 

Overall we really enjoyed the experience of Kalimantan. We could not have seen this part of the world without the hard work of Nila and her local guides. We would recommend her company to anyone wanting to experience such a different and important part of Indonesia, and can‚Äôt wait to do it again!

reviews.text: Nila organised and accompanied me on a customized boat tour on Balikpapan Bay, including mangrove forests and the Pantai Lango fishing community. Very professional and correct. Nila is perfectly English-speaking and very nice company!

reviews.title: Short stay in Borneo
reviews.text: Nila arranged a private tour for us during our short visit to Borneo.  Her attention to detail and our comfort was excellent.  I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend their company to anyone travelling to Borneo.  Thank you for a wonderful time.

reviews.title: 5-day canoe tour along the Mahakam river
reviews.text:
Review Nila

My dad and I traveled to Kalimantan for a few days in April 2018, hoping to take a break from other touristic islands in Indonesia and go on a hand crafted tour up the jungle, visiting remote villages and spotting wildlife along the way. We approached Nila after arriving in Balikpapan, when we found out we would have trouble visiting the Mahakam river on our own. A few hours after my email and when no other company had replied to us, we got a phone call to our hotel room at 9 PM : Nila had come to the hotel to talk about the options she could offer us. She was very attentive to our constraints of budget and time and she then sent a few packages by email later that night. We decided to take the ‚ÄúMahakam River backpacker trip‚Äù and she could even arrange to depart the next day. Our 5-day trip was a totally unique experience, meeting with local tribes, riding up the river with a very skilled canoe man (dotted with special x-ray eyes when it comes to spotting animals in the trees!), visiting traditional villages, encountering with monkeys, snakes and exotic bird species, and tasting the delicious local food specialties. All this led by our awesome guide, Djumri, a native of a Kutai tribe and also a descendant of the regency‚Äôs royal family. Djumri has been a fantastic person to meet and a very interesting and attentive guide, as well as speaking perfect English. He even managed to fulfill our need of raw veggies after eating so much deep fried stuff, haha. 
We really enjoyed the trip, during which we were just the two of us plus our guide and sometimes our canoe man or a driver, which adds up to the reasons why we enjoyed it so much, since we were seeking exactly this kind of "off the grid" tourism experience. In many villages we visited we were the only foreigners the people had seen in weeks. Although it is a unique and quite enjoyable experience, it can sometimes feel uncomfortable for a young western woman in such conservative places, with locals clearly showing that they are not used to see people from my culture and customs, but our guide explained that he usually travels with older people which made it really surprising to see a younger ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù woman. I have never felt unsafe or endangered though, just bothered sometimes as a shy person. 
Another aspect that could be addressed in order to deliver the greatest experience, at least in my personal opinion, would be to try and influence the local populations to reduce their waste. As in most countries in south east Asia, with no exception for these remote and traditional livings, people consume a lot of processed, packaged food. The packagings often end up in the river, and we saw monkeys playing amongst dirty diapers, plastic bottles and aluminum cans. I was expecting a more pristine, natural environment. If tourism could have a positive impact on making these populations aware of the importance of preserving their nature, it would be a huge progress. 
Overall, we had a really great time traveling with this tour. I hope to be able to do it again before Borneo gets more touristic, hopefully someday when the local populations start being more conscious of the importance of preserving their environment and prevent from wasting so much plastic packaging in the river :) This was by far the most authentic travel I got to experience and I hope the tour continues educating tourists to this kind of raw experiences. Thank you so much Nila and Djumri for such a beautiful trip in Kalimantan !

reviews.title: An excellent adventure tailored to our needs
reviews.text: Nila perfectly understood our needs as older travellers. We adored our adventure to visit first the orang outangs and sun bears; then to explore the Mahakan river and its backwaters by motorised canoe, staying in dayak village guesthouses. Our wonderful guide was informative, very helpful and had a great sense of humour. We saw very few other tourists and felt privileged to enjoy such an individual tour within our relatively tight budget.

reviews.title: Absolutely Lovely Tour!
reviews.text: I would not hesitate in recommending Nila and her amazing tour. We only had 48 hours in Balikpapan so our schedule was tight but Nila organised an amazing itinerary and fit in so much. We felt like princesses as she did everything. Our highlight was when she took us to her two favourite local restaurants. Amazing food and amazing company! Please book with Nila - honestly, you will have an amazing time! If we are ever back in Balikpapan (hopefully!) we will find Nila and do a longer tour!

reviews.title: Souvenirs Market
reviews.text:
Wherever you visit a place, make sure to bring souvenir of the place. And this place is the center of souvenirs for Kalimantan/Borneo.

You can get almost everything here. From bracelet, necklace, key chain, clothes to some traditional medicine.

reviews.title: #1 Place to hunt souvenirs
reviews.text:
I personally will recommend this place as ultimate destination to buy souvenir from Balikpapan - East Kalimantan. The price is cheaper (don't forget to bargain but keep it fun), many choices from amplang for 10 ribu, sarong for 20 ribu, tshirt for 25 ribu, or even gemstone that priced up to millions rupiah.
Some tips for you: plan your visit here, because shopping in a hurry may not satisfied you. Use something comfy and avoid too many accessories because the place is narrow and crowded, plus be cautious for pickpocket. If you were hungry in the middle of your shopping time, there are some seafood restaurants at the back, Haur Gading is famous.

reviews.title: Souvenirs, souvenirs, souvenirs
reviews.text:
I've already visited this place for a few times and it still is my favourite place for buying souvenirs in Balikpapan. For starters, if you want to visit this place in Balikpapan just say 'take me to Pasar Inpres Kebun Sayur' to your driver or friends.
Things that i usually bought here are
1. Sasirangan batik, its a type of batik from Kalimantan Selatan that was made with similar process of tie dye (pict 1)
2. Ampiek batik, its a different type of batik that is native to Kalimantan Timur (pict 2)
3. Bead handcraft, from necklaces to bags (pict 3).
4. etc

Tips:
When youre at Pasar Inpres Kebun Sayur dont be afraid to bargain, try at least til half of the price they first offered and be friendly. Its a local market anyway.

reviews.title: Balikpapan Superblock is Super!
reviews.text:
Balikpapan Superblock, which is in Jln. Jendral Sudirman, is definitely the biggest and best shopping venue in Balikpapan. After it had opened in 2009, the place was swarming with people wanting to visit the place. You might think now that in the pandemic this place will be empty, but on the contrary it is still full of people.

This place, which is full of shops, also has many other things to do such as a cinema, restaurants, entertainments and many more. I had been wanting to go back to this place since the beginning of the pandemic. Usually, places this big are hard to go around, but on the other hand there are many signs to show where places are.

Overall this place is definitely my favourite place to go to in Balikpapan.

reviews.title: E.Walk (BSB) The Light Of Balikpapan Since 2009
reviews.text:
Ewalk opened since 9th September 2009 , E ‚Äì Walk Balikpapan has been considered as one of the leading retail industries, as well as the brand leader of entertainment and attractions in Balikpapan Built on a land area of 12000 square meters inside Balikpapan Superblock, Ewalk is considered the most popular mall due to its abundance of attractions, restaurants, general needs, and shopping centers.  

 

Although a new mall has opened called Pentacity, Ewalk is still popular due to its long and more popular in general, I had gone to Ewalk more times than I can count on my own two hands and every time I had gone home from the mall, I had went to the mall on weekends before the whole pandemic and usually watch a movie and eat out, in which im always content on my visit. 

 

Overall I would say that Ewalk is a staple to Balikpapan and I would highly recommend you to visit this place if your visting Balikpapan or have free time

reviews.title: Brilliant first view of Borneo's top sights (in East Kalimantan). Can't wait to go back
reviews.text:
We are two NZ friends and frequent travellers who took a 4N5D Mahakam River and Kutai Park tour with Rimba Borneo, with guides Rusdy and Longfa April 2019. The trip was fantastic - made so by Rusdy's good organisation and the pair's great cooking. They were also a good laugh and relaxing to travel with.

We spent approx 2 nights and 1 day around the Mahakam River area, where the highlight was a day-long tour in a sturdy little wooden boat. There was lots to see around a series of rivers, lakes and communities. It was eye-opening and interesting to understand how the people living there made the best of the natural environment. Many lead a demanding life on houses on stilts or floating on the water or water's edge, with fishing and raising swiftlets for their nests the main earners on the water. Nearby there's also huge coal mines, with some eyebrow-raising barge loads passing incongruously along the river. Only similar thing we've seen are communities up the Amazon River from Leticia, Colombia to Peru, and to the floating fishermen villages in Halong Bay, Vietnam. But nothing on the scale there.

Up one river surrounded by bush, it was possible to see a lot of proboscis monkeys and birds... we loved that. And not far from there, we had a good look round the beautiful old wooden Lamin Adat Mancong long house - a type of large communal home. 

Overnights were in more-populated villages in quirky but clean guest houses. The locals were smiley, relaxed and curious to see us, but didn't chat much other than asking for the occasional photo (we would have loved to sit with them and learn a craft or recipe to talk longer). We saw only one other tourist pair the whole time. Tourism definitely hasn't arrived yet.

After one day's drive, seeing some interesting bush and different types of villages and the city of Samarinda out the window, we went to Kutai National Park. This is one of the areas where the Indonesian Government protects the habitat for orangutans. Access was via a similar little wooden boat, 20 mins motoring up a river and we stayed in the ranger's lodge with a ranger who had come to stay when we were there... that was a really cool element of the tour. 

The lodge has a beautiful site and plenty of space, however is quite basic, so travellers need to be relaxed. We slept on clean sheets on old mattresses under mosquito nets in a private room that could sleep 3-4 at a squeeze. Washing was cold water, tap and bucket. It was fairly hot and noisey from animals in the surrounding jungle! (If you're the type of person worried about that... it's not for you).

Around the lodge, we loved: The night walk to see all sorts of birds, bugs, frogs and spiders, then the 8am (easy) walk, where we found four orangutans having their morning tea in the wild, swinging round the trees. Watched them for 3-4 hours. Later, other animals showed up around the lodge, including macaques, a civet, monitor lizard.. loads to see. And there was good time for resting and reading books etc. While there, you have a ranger pretty much to yourself to show you everything.

Food for the whole tour was absolutely delicious. A mix cooked by Rusdy or from rapid stops at restaurants. His treats included: omelettes, banana pancakes and copious fruit for breakfast; beautiful little fish with tasty toppings, battered chicken and noodles, loads of vegetables and huge prawns negotiated from the local fishermen for lunch and dinner. Vegetarians would be easily catered for. 

Our tour finished when we were dropped at Samboja Lodge.

We did a bunch of research to find tours which respected the natural environment and were very happy with this one. Highly-recommended

reviews.title: Good value for the money - a nice quite course surrounded by a tropical jungle.
reviews.text:
Presently there are only nine holes open due to the amount of upkeep required during the pandemic so only holes 1 - 9 were  maintained.   We just play nine holes twice.   You can walk or buggy either way it's great value for the money. 
Grounds crews have been doing a lot of good work out there but the bunkers are still terrible.    Stay out of them if possible.

reviews.title: Worst mall I've ever been
reviews.text: Literally there were only two shops open, KFC and JCO donut. Couldn't even find the entrance and exit. Asked security about the other shops and he said the rent there was too expensive so no shops could afford it.

reviews.title: Not Much to Do
reviews.text:
Not many shops there, lots of tenant are still empty..
The sea view from the mall building are an ok to see though..

reviews.title: Mall like every other
reviews.text: Nice mall with a lot of shops. They have for everybody something and there is a big cinema with an excellent room with loungeseats. We watched Jurrasic World, which was English spoken with Indonesian subtitles. They are building a new work/living/shopping centre next to it and that is why it is full with stands for selling apartments for the new centre.

reviews.title: Parkir agak ke dalam
reviews.text: Mall dengan konsep di pinggir pantai, masuk di pusat kota balikpapan. enak makan malam sambil melihat laut.

reviews.title: Keren
reviews.text: Tempat makan yang tenang, asyik dan lezat. Sangat tepat membawa keluarga besar, rekan bisnis atau sekedar duduk sendirian santai

reviews.title: Mall yang menghadap laut
reviews.text: Saya mengujungi mall ini ketika masih baru berdiri di sekitar awal tahun 2013. Mall megah, dan menjadi pusat keramaian pengunjung, karena view laut yang indah, apalagi saat senja, ketika banyak rig offshore yang mulai menampakkan cahaya lampu kerlap kerlipnya.

reviews.title: Moll yang Mulai ditinggalkan
reviews.text: Beberapa tahun lalu pertama saya ke Balikpapan, Balcony City masih menjadi sebuah icon kota yang merupakan Moll yang langsung menghadap ke laut yang di klaim saat itu moll pertama yang menghadap ke laut. Saat ini moll ini sudah sepi bahkan ada sebagian orang bilang bahwa moll ini sudah tutup. Tapi sebetulnya masih ada bioskop yang selalu ramai pengunjung ketika ada film baru launching. Hanya bioskop yang masih eksis di Balcony City sedangkan stand lainnya hanya sekedar untuk menghabiskan masa sewa bahkan banyak yang sudah tutup. Jika anda ingin mengunjungi atau sekedar ingin menonton bioskop singgahlah ke Balcony City Balikpapan. Untuk mencapai lokasi ini dari terminal BP bisa naik angkot nomor 5 dan 6, sedangkan jika dari terminal Batu Ampar atau Pelabuhan Semayang bisa naik angkot nomor 3 turun di jembatan BC dan jalan sekitar 500m. Selamat Berkunjung.

reviews.title: Mall pinggir laut yg sangat sepi
reviews.text: Saya kesini krn 1 blok dgn hotel sy menginap,tapi mallny sangat sepi seperti mau tutup. Mall ny sebenarny terletak di lokasi strategis dgn view laut yg sangat indah

reviews.title: Mall besar nan sepi :(
reviews.text: Mall ini desainnya bagus bertujuan untuk menyatukan pasar traditional dan modern, dimana pasar traditional tetap dipertahankan dibawah sedang modern mall dibangun diatasnya. Banyak tenant-tenant terkenal disini dan khususnya untuk view food courtnya langsung menghadap laut... pas banget berlama-lama disini pilih lokasi untuk menyantap makanan yang outdoor sambil menikmati hembusan angin  Chain Hotel Swiss Bell juga dibangun persis disamping mall yang memiliki ballroom terbesar menghadap langsung ke laut dan memiliki akses khusus ke dalam mall  Tapi sayang entah mengapa pengunjung mall ini makin hari makin sepi. Jadi akhirnya membuat kita kurang semangat untuk kemari,

reviews.title: Sepi Mallnya
reviews.text: Sebenarnya Malll ini bisa dikatakan bagus, karena di area tersebut menyatu dengan hotel dan tempatnya menghadap laut. Hanya banyak tenant yang kosong sehingga menjadi sepi pengunjung. perlu banyak kagiatan supaya mallnya hidup kembali. Karena letak tempatnya sudah strategis.

reviews.title: Hotel sekaligus mall
reviews.text: Sepert nya memang lagi booming di Indonesia hotel jadi satu dengan mall, tidak terkecuali untuk tempat yang satu ini, harga barang yang ditawarkan relatif murah, selain dekat dengan plaza balikpapan dan berada dikawasan strategis, mall yang satu ini juga berada di pinggir pantai dan dibagian bawah nya terdapat pasar basah untuk berjualan ikan dan sayur mayur. sayangnya masih banyak toko yang kosong didalam mall ini sehingga terkesan tidak ramai, orang biasa nya pergi ketempat ini hanya untuk menonton atau nongkrong di cafe cafe yang terletak dibagian belakang mall.

reviews.title: Mal besar dengan pemandangan laut
reviews.text:
Dengan view laut dan langsung merasakan angin laut saat berada di bagian belakang mal, menjadi daya tarik tersendiri.
Tapi sekarang kondisinya lebih sepi.
Padahal bangunan Mal yang masih baru dan juga akses koneksi ke hotel Swissbel.
Terdapat banyak tempat makan dan juga tempat hiburan bioskop di lantai paling atas.

reviews.title: Mall Sepi di Tepi Laut
reviews.text: Tepatnya di pinggir jalan raya Jenderal Sudirmand dekat atau disamping Balikpapan Plaza, pusat belanja nya sepi karena toko-toko atau outlet-outlet banyak tutup atau bangkrut atau kurang laku. Apalagi foodcourt atau restoran masih ada tidak terlalu ramai dan tidak antri, Mall ini mempunyai menginapan dijadikan satu bangunan yaitu Swiss-Belhotel Balikpapan.

reviews.title: Mall besar yang sepi
reviews.text: Mall yang sangat sepi dan kurang laku. Tempat makan yang tidak perlu mengantri, sepi sekali. Lokasi sebenarnya menarik sekali di pinggir laut.

reviews.title: Antara hidup dan gulung tikar
reviews.text: Kata teman saya, dulu ini ramai dan foodcourtnya bagus dan pemandangannya laut. tapi saat saya kesini ternyata hampir 85 persen tenant nya sudah tidak ada dan gulung tikar. Hanya bberapa saja. Bioskop masih ada. Tapi sudah tak banyak yang diharapkan  dari mall ini

reviews.title: Mall dengan pemandangan laut yang menyenangkan
reviews.text: Ini merupakan mall yang relatif baru di Balikapapan, berdekatan dengan Balikpapan Plaza. Posisinya berdekatan yang hanya dibelah oleh sungai kecil diantaranya. Dipinggir laut terdapat hotel. Pada prinsipnya ini adalah waterfront mall dan hotel, yang mengutamakan pandangan laut dan tampak dari laut. Alhasil, mall ini tidak terlihat ramai dari jalan raya karena mengusung muka mall yang berbeda. Di sebut Balcony karena terdapat area balkon yang menghadap laut yang dilengkapi dengan food court, sehingga kegiatan bersantai makan dan minum dengan pemandangan laut dengan suasana yang nyaman. Memang menyenangkan menikmati akhir pekan dengan berbagai pilihan makanan dan minuman dipinggir laut.

Our mission is to bridge cultures and community through cultural exchange and social-service with our youth and adult travel programs. Our youth program is committed to financing a minimum of 70% of travel expenses to under-resourced youth throughout Chicago. Our Adult Angel Trips directly funds our youth program and is tax deductible.
